review: Family dinner -  Shared chicken fajita and bacon burger with wife. Had a Texas cheese fries for appetizer. We gave 3.5 stars for the burger, 3 stars for the fajita and 4 stars for the Texas cheese fries. Kids had mac and cheese and pepperoni pizza. Kids gave 5 stars for their meals. Speed of service was slow. Then again it's Friday. Overall service was fair. Value of food is excellent... Going with the lowest solid score, I would give today's experience 3 stars

Chili's in livermore Went to this place for lunch / dinner cant remember what the waitress mixed my meal up with another customers meal. My food was way over cooked the manager straightened out the issue then when it came to paying my bill i was over charged 11.00 had to locate the waitress and the manager to make it right again Paid cash gave a 20 bill for my meal i didn't have the corect change the manager took my money and never returned with my change  REALLY CRAPPY CUSTOMER SERVISE!!!  I had to go thru 3 different people to find out where my money and bill disappeared too. The manager took my money i figured she took ownership . I called to let her know i didnt like her failed responsibility about what happend and it pissed off the customer she could care less...

They messed up my order 4 times and expected us to pay full price. First, the fries were cold, then I asked for no onions and to my surprise, I found onions inside of my burger, the lettuce was wilty, and they were slow

The food is very good they are very good ribs very good steaks very good hamburgers the chicken not so good but let's face it this not a French restaurant this is not a fancy restaurant this is just basic good American food you go there watch football have a beer I need a great juicy hamburger have some good juicy baby back ribs baby baby baby baby back ribs

Love the service and great rewards program through Plenti. All their promo deals keep me coming back. Since I work in the area it's a nice place to go and sit down. Love their steak entrees and burgers. You can never go wrong.

I have always been a fan of Chili's! Well not anymore!  My first crummy encounter was a to-go order. I waited at their to-go counter for almost 10 minutes before someone offered to help. I got the smothered smoked chicken burrito and it was horrible. There was no sauce and was the driest thing I have ever had. I specifically asked for no sour cream and apparently that meant give extra sour cream and no burrito sauce! I also asked for the side to be rice, again not included. Being that it was to-go there wasn't anything I could do. I played it off as a bad visit.  I decided to return with my company. We were seated promptly and already I thought it was going to be great. We waited for 20 minutes before someone wanted to claim our table. Now, there was a party of six who sat directly in front of our table about 10 minutes after we sat down and not only were they greeted, they had their drinks and their food ordered before we even were greeted. Again our food was far from spectacular with sides missing and never a check in to see how we were or even drink refill.  Well why would I go back? Ugh, because I thought MAYBE it was just the holidays and the service/food was rushed. Today I again ordered online. Food was ok but I opted out of eating it and donated it to the dumpster after what I witnessed. I walked in the to-go door and waited in puddles of water as there seems to be some sort of leak. Standing water attracts bugs and other things! As I stood there waiting to be acknowledged.. AGAIN, I witnessed a server walk up to the food, touch the food with her bare hands JUST AFTER SHE WAS TOUCHING HER HAIR. She proceeded to lift up the hamburgers and go through the condiments. I witnessed this on 2 orders. She then asked where "Luke" was but with other choice words. I was disgusted. I threw my food away and I will never come back. All three visits were at this location. Maybe one day I will venture into another location but never this one! Chili's corporate needs to address this location! ASAP!
Chili's is always kool wit me ya diggg...this Livermore location has beeen really kool for yearz...even when short staffed and over crowded this Chili's is on it...

Estee was amazing she really made my day and when she was taking my 5 year olds order she was very patient and professional he is very indecisive I appreciate all her hard work and everything we need was brought fast five stars Estee thanks again!!!
Waited to long just to get cold food and then walked out to find another place to eat. NOT Good
Just left Chilis from having dinner for my daughter's birthday. Excellent service! Food was great and they even sang a cute happy birthday song. This is one of our favorite dinner spots in town.

Ordered to go ...for sure didn't order the food poisoning to go with it . I am pretty certain it was the mexican street corn since that's the first thing I threw up this morning.  I have had diarrhea off and on all day and feel terrible.  I hasve eaten here so many times so I was shocked to have gotten sick.  Maybe all the new workers..i reported it online and will be calling store to let them know ..
Jake was are waiter tonight! I love good service and super friendly waiters. He was very attentive, food was quick and tasty!!  Thank you for making my dad laugh Jake!  I'll be back for sure :)

This place ALWAYS screws up my ToGo orders. Always. So, if you order an order to go...check it before you leave or you will be disappointed. Aside from that... This is your typical casual dinner  experience. Decent food, cold beer.

Very disappointed. I placed an online order that was subpar to say the least. My crispers weren't pre-sauced. My salad was hot because it was put with my hot food. My salad had tomatoes which I very clearly ordered to be removed from the salad. It added cheese and charged me for it when it was only about 5 pieces in total. Beyond disappointed. I'd give 2.5 if able to but I can't unfortunately.
Ordered chips and queso for pick up. My hubby picked it up and brought it home. They literally gave us maybe half a cup of queso.
This place is horrible, this staff really needs to up theory game. If my kid didn't love this place I would never come back! Slow service and lousy food even for a chilis.

We ordered dinner to go. First off, their website did not offer a specification on how we wanted our burgers cooked so I had to call the restaurant to tell them medium rare. 2nd, we were told our order would be ready in 35 minutes. I arrived at the restaurant to pick up 40 minutes later and still had to wait for our order to be put together.  While waiting, the cashier helped pack our order up which was fine. The gross part was she took our onion rings out of one container and moved them to another with her bare, unwashed hands and wiped the crumbs on the butt of her pants. I quietly told her (in the nicest way I could, despite how grossed out I was) that I saw her using her bare hands that she uses to exchange money to touch our onion rings. No apology, no comment. All she said was "Ok".  If our experience wasn't bad enough, I get home to find our salad missing, and the extras that we ordered for our burgers (jalapenos, bbq sauce, guac, etc.) that I paid EXTRA for were missing from our order. Needless to say, we will be ordering dinner elsewhere in the future.

I figured it was time I finally gave this place a little praise. Chili's is always the answer for my wife and I when we don't know what either of us want for dinner.  Chips and salsa, Two for $22 and Trivia or Life on the tablet at the table. Never fails to satisfy me. It's so simple.  My wife is pregnant so she can't drink, but when she wasn't we loved experimenting with all the different fun mixed drinks Chili's has. She loved the watermelon cooler. I like the presidente margaritas. When our kid finally comes we are totally looking forward to this being our family night out restaurant. Don't break the bank, and get food where you get exactly what you expect. Best part about this place though? Not driving around 30 minutes for parking like you do downtown.

I ordered the special which you get 3 items for $10. I ordered a chicken fajitas and also chips and salsa. The chips and salsa were delicious but the problem I had was the chicken was not really grilled .Also the chicken, the onions and a peppers were cold. I only live 5 minutes away..Very disappointed

This was an unusual late dinner after work. Even more unusual that we chose Chili's since we've never been big fans but it was here or Denny's. I think we made the wrong choice. We sat in the bar. The atmosphere is kinda cool though the TV's were quite loud. Our server Brayan was attentive and polite. Now for the critique- My Caribbean salad had only 3 pieces of pineapple and those had bits of peel and hadn't been cored (uneatable), the cranberries and raisins were dried out(old), the lettuce wasn't even real cold. On the plus side there was plenty of shrimp. But be forewarned- the "Honey-Lime" dressing doesn't taste like either but it does taste like mustard, -the Balsamic dressing tastes like someone mixed Honey-Lime with a shot of vinegar, yuk. I love big, bold flavors but chewing on warm mustard seeds doesn't qualify. $11.89 and I ate 1/3 of it. Hubby's Prime Rib Tacos were equally disappointing. The meat was less like prime rib and more like pot roast slathered in some kind of fake "grilling sauce", VERY little avocado, black beans were room temp and didn't get eaten. Then, on my way to the bathroom I walked all the way through the mostly empty restaurant and saw food scraps under every table. One gal was sweeping (kinda) and the others were....? Needless to say I won't be back. At least at Denny's I know what to expect --like kitchen help that doesn't know how to properly cut up a pineapple but at least they know which foods are supposed to be hot and which are supposed to be cold. By reading all these reviews it's really surprising they are still around. The management reads these and must not really care that they are on the same path as Applebee's as nothing is changing. Fine by us, we'll wait for another hot spot to take their place.

By far one of the worst dining experiences I've had. Far worse than BJ's a few weeks ago and I really thought that was bad. Walked in at about 5pm, restaurant is generally empty. No hostess in sight. Lots of staff walking nearby and completely ignoring us. I finally yelled to one of them to be seated.  We get seated and our server was decently attentive and accommodating. He brought one set of silverware for 3 of us and a pile of napkins. I guess he figured my children would eat with their hands and thus need cleaning afterwards.  Napkins had blood, or what appeared to be blood on them. I pointed it out to the manager and the waiter did not take away the other napkins in the pile. He did, however bring me another napkin with blood on it....From the same bin. Manager "investigates" and determines that it's not blood but rather a watermelon sauce. I'm not convinced, nor am I impressed. I am a nurse so I feel fairly confident in recognizing blood. But...ok.  Food was mediocre at best and now I'm nauseous because I can't stop thinking about the blood and wondering what else had blood on it. I should have left then but any mother knows that leaving with two starving children to attempt to start dinner over again somewhere else is a perilous task.  I convinced myself that it either wasn't blood or that it wasn't in the food processing areas. I hope I was right. No. I will not be eating at Chili's...ever....again.

I'm a long time Livermore resident.  For some reason I have always went to Applebee and not Chili's.  On my last two dinner outings I decided to go to Chili's instead.  I was very pleasantly surprised by my visits.  Service was very attentive, food was tasty and the atmosphere was good.  The wait to be seated and to get the food out was a little slow but the waiters I had more then made up for the difference.  They made sure we were ok, kept the drinks full, and checked in on use to let us know the food was on its way and they hadn't forgot about us.

Had a late lunch here on 8/24/13.  We sat in the bar and our server was Ariana.  She was nice and very efficient.   We like Chilis partly b/c of the chips and salsa so we started w/ that and added some guacamole which was rather tasty- they add corn to the guac which I liked.   We decided on the 2 for $20 option where you share an appetizer and you get two full sized entrees.  I ordered the Margarita Grilled Chicken (Lighter Choice) and added corn tortillas b/c they are my newest addiction.  The portion was perfect and the taste was good- I would order again.  My boyfriend ordered the Crispy Honey-Chipotle Chicken Crispers- he said the corn on the cob was over cooked- it looked like it- and everything else was fine.  I would visit this location again and I would sit in the bar area again as well- it's open seating- you can't go wrong w/ a comfy booth and several tvs.
Service was good, staff was friendly and attentive but the food was just ok.  Seems like the portions have gotten smaller and the prices have gone up.
We go here ALL the time and always have a good experience. The staff is great, the food is great. We never have to wait for our food or the bill. For a chain you can't go wrong with this place!

So this time I didn't actually eat. But hey, it happens with me. I come here often with my bf because it's local and the food is pretty decent. Tonight was the same- fast service, friendly waitress, and good food. The appetizer of chicken nachos was a bit dry and could have used some guacamole (so I was told). :) My bf ate his crispy chicken tacos so fast I'm surprised I actually got a picture of them! We were in and out of here in about an hour. Awesome!  Keep sending us coupons Chili's, and we'll keep coming back to use them.
Management here has forgot the meaning of service, kiosk at tables, lack of servers, will not be back

We really like this restaurant.  They allow to customize the French fries. Their French fries is the best . Being from Holland we like to eat French fries with finely cut union and mayo. The mayo is the glue that attaches the French fries to the union. Very delicious. We really appreciate the flexibility of the management to let us to indulge on the Dutch treat. That is what management should be all about customer focus!!
YUK. Ordered take out. Chicken Crispers were literally frozen and rock hard under the fried breading, had to throw it away.

The food is nothing special, typical chain restaurant fare. Our server today, Fidel, was hands down one of the best in any restaurant around. Very personable, very attentive without being over bearing, overall made 2 star food into a 4 star rating.

BEST HAPPY HOUR, it's a secret they don't advertise.  If you eat in the bar area, all day, every day.  You can't beat bottomless chips, which are the best tortilla chips around, light and salty with their salsa.   We are regulars, and their beer IS THE COLDEST IN TOWN.  A Large Coors Light is only $3.99 during happy hour and those glasses are more than 16 oz.  probably 22 oz?  Have a good assortment of beers on tap, so you can go import or IPAs.   Haven't had a problem yet with orders being incorrect or slow service. YET.  Happy hour appetizers are substantially great prices and are meals in themselves, sliders/fried, fries/jalapeno/chili, pretzel sticks, chicken nachos, bonless or bone in chicken wings, all only either $2.99 or $4.99.    Not to mention you can watch your any of your favorite sports on the various televisions they have. This review is strictly for happy hour and the bar area.  The same waitresses have been there and have yet to have a bad experience here.
Terrible service at the bar, guy can't even give you a menu.  He was not busy just a stress cadet tool my money somewhere won't be back.   Crap service, do yourself a favor go somewhere else.

Went for dinner on a Sunday eve with my family. First we ordered chips and salsa . The chips were old and stale. It Took 30 min for waitress to bring glass of wine. Over an hour for our food to be served. My son ordered chicken quesadillas and they were over cooked. Our waitress was friendly but unknowledgeable. Spoke to the manager and she assisted with remedying the situation. We will go back another time and hopefully things will be better.
Decent food decent service all in all the place was not the best but not the worst would u come back to this place? Maybe but the thing I enjoyd the most is the chili

Recently remodeled store, though the exterior color scheme now vaguely resembles BJs, which oddly enough, is due to open a few miles up 580 near the new Target at Fallon Road.  Anyway. Not a fan.  A number of the walls are down, and the rows of booths parallel to the kitchen on the right (as you walk in) are now open tables "floating" in the center of the floor.  Which is fine, but I feel somewhat like an animal at the zoo in such settings.  They still have some booths, but apparently a party of five (not to be confused with Party of Five) are often relegated to this area.   Can't hate the player for the decor, but the service wasn't super-duper, either. Three of us were here and ready to graze on some chips and salsa (graze, geez... another zoo implication) with a tasty beverage, but the server didn't appear until the other two folks arrived.  Refills weren't too speedy either, and not like I was downing my soda with the same fervor of a few years back (our table decided to test a Planet Hollywood's "unlimited refills" speed... 45 second to 1:15, by the by -- impressive). Here, less impressive.  Finally surrendered and ended up drinking the last of a clear, non-carbonated, non-flavored complimentary beverage I stole from another at our table.  Met the need, but wasn't nearly as satisfying.   All told... *now* I remember why Chili's isn't part of my regular dining out line card.

Hoping Fabian Alonzo (manager name posted on door) will see this. Just left after eating at this very filthy restaurant. TWICE we were brought a stack of "clean" dishes to our table that had food on them (LOTS of food- noodles with cheese and wet lettuce on another). The friendly waitress quickly brought us paper plates at our request. Food was okay. As we left we walked by kitchen after leaving restroom and saw a filthy kitchen. Overall- very friendly staff with prompt service but hygiene is a real concern. I do not recommend this place until they implement the necessary workflow to be compliant with health code. Sorry, hate to write negative reviews but this was really gross (even to my 2 teen boys who joined my husband and I for a family meal). Should add- my husband who was in the army was the only one not horribly offended.

It is so awesome being able to pay at the table and the updates on the menu are great. I've had Chili's To Go twice (so far) and sat in the bar a few times and had great service. The carnitas and shrimp fajitas are so good! Good service on the inside and love being able to pick it up hot and quick.
Please make the wine refrigerator colder!! Told management few times but no difference!

Service was just OK, seriously rather have a burger from burger king than this place. Meat was dry and tasteless and enough mustard for three burgers. Fries were stale and room temp. This was second time trying this order second time disappointed. Learned my lesson.

Went here on Halloween to avoid the barking of dogs over withches and goblins ringing the doorbell.  Yes yes I am 'one of those people'! I ordered the Chicken & Green Chili Soup with with rice, green chiles and tomatoes. It came with cilantro and avocado on top and was quite pleasantly surprised with how good it was & only 200 calories???.  My daughter had the Quesadilla Explosion Salad that was really yummy.     I think the trick to getting good service is to sit in the bar area even if you aren't drinking adult beverages. I guess it does keep getting better as the saying goes.  Fourth star for offering up some healthy options other than the heart attack platter better known as the jalapeno smokehouse burger with ranch which weighs in at a whopping 2200 calories and 144 grams of fat!

This is the second time I have been there n the second time I have been so impressed with the service. We had 12 last time n 8 this time. Historically large party service sucks, I've found. Not here, it's EXCEPTIONAL both times. Last time I tipped 28% n called back n tipped another $20 later that night. They r sweet sharp n on the ball. Tdays service was that way AGAIN!! Plus the food is always great, it's Chili's who doesn't love Chili's!!! Fast hot fresh n yummy, thanks Chili's!!!!
This was the worst meal ever!!! Overcooked dry boneless buffalo wings. The steak was a boot. Just the worse meal ever.  REFUND FROM CC COMPANY UH YES PLEASE.

Ok...my husband and I go out A LOT (we have been married 45 yrs and are very easy going people) ,,,one thing that REALLY turns us off a place is feeling OVER ATTENDED by a server....last night we lost count after 7 times the waiter walked by our table and asked if we needed anything, food ok, etc...I said at the 5th time, no thank you, if we do, we will ask..  and he kept doing it to the point I was going to ask if we were on a "How long before I can piss off the customer" t.v. show!!!! There is a limit on how much time the server needs to be THAT available...actually ONCE is enough and they are all around us so if we need more they are easy to find.....and TOOOOOO much salt and seasonings on most foods....only went there because I was given a gift card. Thanks!!!

I came here with my mother taking her out to dinner. Paid almost 90 dollars for burnt tasteless food. Preferred steak and ribs. Took about an hour for my order to come out just for my steak to be tough and dry ! The ribs were worse! Tasteless and burnt! No mean on the bone whatsoever! The appetizer was alright. Had a trainee server who was nice but didn't check up on us at all. Had to ask for my water to be refilled constantly. Every time I come in my food is always burned or flavorless! I don't think I'll be back. Poor quality

Almost always a perfect experience at this Chili's. Can get really busy on Fridays, especially during the holidays but the wait staff is always friendly. We placed a to-go order today and had some issues. The manager, Fabian, was super friendly about it and was happy to work with us. He ended up reversing the charge of the meal. We will be back. Thank you, Fabian!

Best Chili's we've had in our 2.5 years in the US.  We stopped here en route to Stockton, for lunch, it was busy, but the food was delicious and came out piping hot and the service was great - what more could you want? I had the chicken buffalo ranch sandwich and hubby had the original crispers - in case you're interested!

I used to be a huge fan of Chili's and we used to go all the time.  About a year ago, my husband daughter and I went one weekend, and I got sick.  I figured it was just the flu but the following week we went back and my daughter got sick so it took us a year to venture back in. Last night was the first night that we ventured back in.  The only reason they are getting one star is because I do like the new decor.  Other than that, it was a horrible experience. First of all, the service is horrible.  Our server was Leslie.  She could not get rid of us soon enough.  Every time she came by she seemed very rushed and it was not even that busy.  Trust me, there were plenty of open tables and she spent plenty of time in the corner.  She brought us our dinner and then as soon as she cleared our plates, she brought us our check. She didn't bother to ask if we wanted anything else or if we wanted dessert. My husband and I both ate light so we could have dessert.   Second, the food looks horrible and was luke warm.  My husband had some buffalo wings and a side salad.  Some of his lettuce was wilted, his wings were thrown on a plate, and his ranch dressing was hot rather than cold.  I ordered the crispy chicken tacos, with no rice or beans.  The tacos came out cold but had clearly been sitting their for a while because the cheese had melted.  These tacos used to come in a rack, now the tortillas are thrown on a plate and all of the stuff is just thrown on top.  My daughters Mac & Cheese and cord were cold and looked old.  I didn't send anything back because Leslie looked irritated already and I didn't feel like wondering what would happen to my food if I sent it back.  As it is, she took a very long time at the cash register in the corner, so I am beginning to wonder if I am going to have some extra charges on my credit card. I must say sorry to the poor hostess who was probably all of 17 years old.  She asked us how our dinner was and I told her it would have been better if I would have even been offered some dessert.  I am pretty sure she was expecting me to say that everything was great but don't ask me a question if you don't want the real answer. Here are my suggestions: 1.  Get rid of Leslie.  She is going to drive your customers away. 2.  If Michael is still a bartender, have him give your waiters some tips.  You should have kept him as a waiter.  He is by far the best waiter that Chili's has ever had.  He is one of the reasons that we went back week after week in the past. 3.  Get your chefs to go back to culinary school.  Have them focus on presentation.  When the food looks bad, it makes the taste even worse. 4.  Have a manager at the front or someone who can handle complaints when people are asked how their meal was.  That poor girl that was there last night had no idea what to do or say to me.  What would have been nice is if she asked if I wanted to talk to an manager. Other than that, all I can say is good luck.  If more people experience what we experienced last night, you will be with Chevy's....out of business.

If I could give more than 5 stars I would. But this isn't necessarily about chilis it's about Brad. He's awesome!! My dad has autism, and hates big crowds. So we came to chilis on a Sunday, 5 minutes before the doors even opened. My dad had his fingers in her ears, basically rolling in a ball in the booth because the music was kind of loud. Without even asking, Brad turned the music down to help. And it did help a lot. So thank you so much Brad for being awesome.

Bleh!  Worst hamburger ever.  On par with McDonald's, in my opinion.  Reality wanted a good burger.  I don't know why I thought chili's could deliver.  It was tasteless, and dry, and the patty had probably been sitting there all night under the warmer.  Won't be going back.

Ok yes it's chili's and I rarely review chain restaurants but after our experience last night I felt it was needed. We went in for a quick dinner before heading to costco.  Our server was Monica and we told her we were on a time crunch because we wanted to make costco before it closed.  She assured us she would do her best and she really did.  Oh and I forgot to mention the place was packed.  Monica is a Great server and she went that extra mile to make our dinner easy and stress free.  Thanks

Another gift card.... :)  I seem to always get Chili's gift cards from work drawings. *shrugs* Anyways, service was nice.  Seated as soon as we walked in, we were brought water before we thought of what to order.  I asked out server what she recommended: Chili or Sweet Corn Soup - she said sweet corn soup.  So I ordered the soup and salad.  Sweet Corn Soup was SO tasty!  I really liked it, it was a thick creamy soup with corn and maybe some cheese.  I also got the basic house salad, can't imagine anyone using all the dressing that they give you - but you never know.  DH got a big burger and he said it was pretty good.  Better than ordering their BBQ BBRibs.   So, I would come back here - even without a GC to order the soup.  So far its the only thing I really like here.  And our meal was pretty inexpensive... so we will be back to use up the rest of the GC. :)
Wish I could post 0 stars. The quality of the food is very low and tasteless. Don't go.

I might not normally rate this place this high just cause its only chilis. Food is decent as it should be., But the they have these things at your table now where you can play game, order drinks and no more waiting for the waiter to come give you your tab just pay right there it has your order and total and add tio always add tip dont be cheap.

Been waiting here for 15 mins before anyone took a drink over. Server walked by multiple times and didn't even acknowledge us. Service leads a lot to be desired. Atleast the servers are usually friendly when they are able to get to you, and food is good.

Tried the triple dipper appetizer combo for a late lunch--2 mini burgers, onion rings, and "southwest egg rolls".  Service was very slow even though it was after lunch hour.  The food was edible but mediocre at best.  The onion rings were way too thin so they were more breading than onion, and were overcooked but not to the point of being burned.  Red Robin has infinitely better onion rings.  The mini-burgers were dry, the very thin slice of cheese was barely melted, and the bacon was in the form of bacon bits which fall out of the burger when you try to eat it.  The SW egg rolls were a little spicy but aside from that hardly had any flavor.  The appetizer was $11.99 and the iced tea was $2.69--not much of a meal for $16 + tip.  All in all it was very unsatisfying and left me wishing I hadn't eaten anything so I could go out and get an enjoyable lunch somewhere.  P.S. Forgot to mention that I looked in the kitchen on the way to the rest room and the floor was dirty with food scraps.

Great value, food and service.  Seems that the new manager, Fariba, has turned this place around as everyone seems happy to work for her.  I noticed the difference in attitude and even the food was better than before.  The jalapeño bacon burger was excellent!  I'm definitely coming back.

Server was pleasant and service was good but the food was not very good.  The lettuce on my salad was tired and wilted.  When I ordered tea the only thing offered was a generic no-name tea made with tap water.  Finally, we were changed 99 cents after my child decided to play a game on the Kiosk.  I do not think I will be going back anytime soon.

This review is specifically for the ToGo at Chili's Livermore. They have never gotten my order right and I have repeatedly ordered from them because my kids like the food. Whether it's the missing fries, the non-existent cheese or the ketchup and mustard when I ordered plain it's beyond unacceptable. Happened again tonight ( no rice or beans on 2 orders ) and ya go back and all you get is a hollow apology...and cold food when I arrive home after the 2nd run back there for those rice and beans. I usually go through each container while I'm there ( because I ALWAYS have this problem ) but sent someone for me tonight and that's what I get...painful!

Recently came here with a friend for lunch.  We ordered off the "$20 For Two" menu.  For two people, it's almost silly not to order from this menu, which had decent choices.  You get a choice of appetizer and two full-size entrees.  We started with the chips and salsa.  Our friendly server also brought us the fire-grilled corn guacamole since it was also an option off the menu. The chips here were addicting because they were so light and crispy.  For lunch, I had the Bacon Ranch Chicken Quesadillas.  The portions were pretty big; 2 quesadillas.  It was pretty good, but I wished that the tortillas were soft.  Instead, there were toasty and crunchy.   Service was excellent.  Our server was friendly, attentive with refills, and brought us to-go containers appropriately based on what we had left.

My husband and I decided to grab dinner at Chili's Grill & Bar last night. We were there early and were seated right away.  We decided to order from the $20 Dinner For Two menu. For our appetizer we shared a Crispy Onion & Jalapeno Stack. I was not impressed. The crispy onions were greasy and not as spicy as I would have liked. We were then brought the Chicken Fajitas and Cajun Chicken Pasta we had ordered. Once again the food was mediocre. My pasta was very bland and lacking in spice and so were my husbands fajitas.  We were pretty full by this point but decided to order dessert since we had a coupon for a FREE dessert of our choice. We ordered a Molten Chocolate Cake. It was delicious and probably the best part of the meal until I bit into a small white piece of plastic. I am not sure how that even got into the dessert but it did. I am so glad I didn't swallow or chip a tooth on it.  I would have brought this to the managers attention but didn't since my husband just wanted to relax after a long hard day at work.  I am not a fan and will not be back.

I'm usually not a big fan of chain restraunts but I like this place. I get the black bean burger with sauteed mushrooms and swiss cheese. Their fries are the best. It's affordable. The only this I don't is their cocktails. It's not that hard to make a Margarita.

Oooohhhh, The servers are great. Enuf said.. Well not enuf, the food is the standard, US Foods, or Sysco.I had a prawn entree a few years ago, and was very sick. My Husband and kid eat here all the time, I think they go in for the hotty waitresses. But, I'm not a fan. Not a "dining experience". And it is expensive for what you get,

So, I love going to Chilis, if I dont want to cook dinner and just want to hang out. This Chili's is by far the worst one ever. I chose three things off the menu and they didnt have any of it left, so ended up getting a Old Timer Burger which was cold and soggy. The fries were stiff, and the waitress was no where to be seen. This place has got to clean up its act.

Not a bad lunch place, a little more pricey than they used to be.  I had the CRISPY HONEY-CHIPOTLE CHICKEN CRISPERS.  This is how its described on their menu:   "Strips of chicken hand-battered then breaded and fried to perfection for that extra crispy crunch and topped w/our spicy & smoky honey-chipotle sauce. Served with sweet corn on the cob & homestyle fries." It was crispy, but I couldn't really find much chicken.  The fries were a bit soggy and corn was fresh. So,  -1 STAR for too much fried batter. -1 STAR for slow service.  We arrived at 12p, but didn't get out till almost 1:15p.

YOU NEED A NEW MANAGER ASAP! ok so i enjoy going to chilis because they have decent food, and i end up having a good time when i go there with friends or family. i actually had a great today with two of my friends, our server was very nice and attentive. so when we got the check we split in three. one of my friends and i paid the same amount of money on our card, and our other friend paid the same amount in cash. so we leave and i ended up having to go to the store to get my kid diapers, and they denied my card!! i was like wth?? i should have at least $20 on my card left because i hadn't deposited my paycheck yet. so i left target embarrassed because i couldn't get my own child diapers. then when i got home i check my bank account and it said chilis had charged me twice! what the heck?? it wasn't a complicated thing to put freaking $15 on my card! so they ended up charging $30 for a SALAD!!! so then i call chilis and let them know i was charged twice and told them the name of the server which i am too nice to mention his name, but then they were just like 'oh well the bank should see that you were charged twice and your money should be back on your card by next week. i was like okkkkk....then they were like is it REALLY a big deal? oh NO you did not just say that!! ok its not the fact that i lost $15, but the way they treated me after that, as if it were my fault and not the servers. ATTENTION 'MANAGER' THIS IS NOT HOW YOU TALK TO PAYING CUSTOMERS!!  and they didn't offer a free meal or anything like that, which shows how much they care about their customers. hell no dude, you need to get some customer service skills because i won't be back there..shoot especially with a applebees, ihop, and chevys right next to it! :P

We went in on a Friday night as a family. We have 2 little boys and it can be a disaster with kids. We got in pretty quick, they gave our kids some coloring books right off the bat and brought out crackers for them to eat to tide them over. Our food came out quick and we had a great night. We will go back again for sure.
I like Chili's!  Especially the Buffalo wing salad with wasabi dressing.

i am to the point where i think I'm just not gonna eat here anymore.  service has gone down hill, food has gone down hill and management doesn't seem to care.  3 resent events that stand out in my mind are- my sons mac and cheese still having a piece of the plastic boiling wrapper in it. thank god we saw it half way through. it was covered in cheese and he wouldn't have seen it, can we say CHOKING hazard. i notified the manager and her insincere apology was a joke. do you not understand my child could have just choked! that is not something to be taken lightly. they didn't even offer to comp us it.  other event, my son spilling my water all over and servers just walking by and we frantically tried to clean it w/ 2 napkins.  and an older one that i have still yet to forget.  back when they have the potato soup that i used to crave and i also ordered the buffalo salad. i got a order of it from the take out. i was so upset to get home and see they hadn't put any toppings on the soup or the salad. the food was awful. what is a salad that you pay way to much money for that is just chicken, lettuce and dressing? i called them so upset expecting my order to be comped and they said there wasn't a manager there but they would take my number and have them call me. well, i never received any calls back.  man, the more i write this and remember all the frustrations i have had here, i really don't think I'm going back. i think the reason why i have continued is the connivance of it.

This place is hit or miss.  That goes for all Chili's.  But I'm 99% sure it was THIS Chili's that put RAW BACON on my black bean (vegetarian) burger.  Thank God I lifted up the bun to put ketchup on or else I wouldn't have discovered it!  I don't know if it was a mistake or a prank, but it wasn't funny.  That aside, the black bean burger ain't half bad.  And I love their molten chocolate cake.  That stuff is the bomb!  Margaritas and other specialty drinks ain't bad.  But I can't give any place that served me raw bacon with a vegetarian meal more than two stars.

Chili's in Livermore?  Ok, not that quaint but a great place for the family.   First about service:  Probably the best I've seen in this town.  Staff very attentive.  I'd have to say I believe they love what they do.  Walked in and hostess seated us immediately (after first visiting the table and child proffing it with high chairs, moving stuff out of way of grabby hands, etc.)  Our waiter anticiipated every need before it arose.  Extra napkins since we have 2 under the age of 2? He had them at our table within 30 secs of sitting down without being asked.  Appetizer is going to take a few mins longe than expected, so Waiter brings crackers for babies, again without being asked.  Do you have kids?  This is royal treatment for parents!  Hot plates, glasses, you name it, all placed strategically out of the way of little hands.   Food: Not mexican, not american, it's Chili's.  wouldn't say it's genius, but its your average "good".  Had the cajun steak that could have come from Appleby's, Red Robin or some other strip mall restaurant....however: Food plus atmosphere plus service make it an overall great value. Do you want to have a dinner with the family sans cooking and sans the stress?  For that, Chili's in Livermore rocks our world!

My boyfriend and I could not decide what to have for dinner the other night, we decided to try chilli's again since it had been 1 year since our last bad experience there. Bad idea... upon receiving the meals that we ordered (fajitas) as the waitress handed me the plate with the sides sour cream and guacamole on it I saw something on the plate move I was startled so I dropped the plate on the counter and saw some kind of bug crawl off the plate on to the table. The waitress used my napkin to smash it and apologized and said she was going to show her manager. At this point I pretty much lost my appetite and barely touched my dinner. The manager came out and said that he was very sorry that had happened. That was all the manager said he did not even ask if there was anything he could do to make the experience better or if we needed anything. To top it all off we got charged full price for our meals that we didn't even eat. Now I'm not saying we expected it for free but they should of tried to do something for us to make the situation better, it seemed like no big deal to them, which makes me think this kind of thing happens all the time. Next time we want fajitas we will be sticking to our usual spot Chevy's!!

i went here for dinner last week... i thought the food was decent, and the service was good and quick. maybe they have gotten better people working here, or i just caught them on a good day. i would probably go back just out of convienance, plus it's some where my boyfriend can eat his meat and me a salad. we useually try to support family owned restraunts though.... i dont like the chain vibe very much.

I've been to Chili's before-- the food here is okay, the service was so-so, but I was hungry and wanting a burger so I called in and ordered some food to go.  This was a weeknight, I should mention.  I got to Chili's about 15 minutes after calling-- the parking lot was empty, the bar area was empty, and I could see employees milling around as I stood at the to-go counter, yet no one came over to help me.  They all looked at me, but some kept talking with each other while others swept and mopped.  Way to go, guys!  Make the customer feel REALLY wanted!  I waited for 5 minutes, along with another woman who must have been there to pick up food also, and in that entire time, no one acknowledged us.  Sure, I could have yelled at them to get them to come over to me-- and run the risk that they spit in my food or something.  NO THANKS.  So I left.  Five minutes of standing there while employees see you but say nothing-- I'm not giving my money to people like that.  I did call the manager that night-- Stacy-- who apologized, and said she'd talk to the employees.  As if they'd care, though.  Clearly they don't give a crap about their customers.  In any event, I won't be going back.  There are too many other really good restaurants in Livermore (Simply Fondue, Anita's, Strizzi's, and Bruno's, to name a few) that deserve my business.
Service is always friendly, the chips and salsa are the best in town, the kids love the corn dogs and it is an all around great deal for the money.

This is the worst Chilies I have ever been to.  The baby back ribs were more like pork spareribs.  They were served cold.  We had to wait 20 minutes to be served and the restaurant was half empty.  I will never go back again.

Chilis in general has always just been "okay", and the Livermore location is no exception. But after my latest to go order I won't be back. First of all it wasn't ready or even started to be put together at the time it was supposed to be; I even arrived slightly late and the staff seemed to have no idea what I was there for. They weren't friendly at all btw, making me feel like I was in the way just for picking up something I paid (and tipped) for.  I finally got my order and got home and the first issue there was that all of the food was cold. Mind you I live nearby so that wasn't the problem and I've had hot food from them before. It seemed like it had been just sitting out which makes me wonder how my order wasn't ready. They forgot part of my order that I also paid for. But the biggest issue was that AS I was eating my salad I found a 5 or 6 inch long black curly hair that unfortunately I found because it was in my mouth already. So disgusting. I work in food service and this would be unacceptable at my place.  Overall though the biggest issue is that when I called my call for a manager was left on hold. I emailed corporate and two days later I haven't heard a thing. I paid nearly $50 for in inedible meal and didn't have time to drive back. The least they could have done was to acknowledge my issues but they didn't even do that. There are so many other options in this area, I won't be coming back here.
Seriously bad food.   I had the Quesadilla Explosion Salad for lunch today and 3 hours later was throwing up.

I used to come to this Chilis every now and then. The food was alright and the service was always good. Up until my last visit I had went with my boyfriend for dinner and that was the last time I ever came back to any Chilis ever. I had ordered the Chicken Crispers plate. The corn was over seasoned, it was SUPER salty. The chicken was a little soggy but I figured it was just the tempura batter they fry it in. I realized there was also something in my water so I had told our waiter. She was super apologetic and her service was superb, so I figured it wasn't really a big deal to complain about the food cus I was whatever about it all. And my boyfriend decided to order a side because he felt bad about my food turning out the way it did. So he ordered some of the Mac and Cheese with the jalapeños in it. And of course I wasn't fond of it either. Everything in it was just overpowering and I was pretty over it at that point.  Later on, I had woke up in the middle of the night with food poisoning. It was the worst thing ever and I was deciding whether I should call them the next day to let them know but how do you handle those situations? I can't really prove their food was exactly what gave me poisoning but I'm pretty sure that's what it was. It took me about 2 days to recover from it and ever since I stayed far away from Chilis.  The service here is great but the food is just alright. I guess I just got unlucky that night.

The service and the food were outstanding.  The only issue I have was we were once again seated at a booth with a huge rip in the seat.  This has happened before and not only did it look terrible,  it was uncomfortable.  At least tape it up until a repair has been made.

me, my mom, and brothers came in & waited 20 minutes before we were waited and asked what we would like to drink & by the time they came we were frustrated. An old white couple came in and the waiters here waited them RIGHT AWAY. & I honestly believe they are racial over here. Because all the white waiters saw us, ignored us and my mom said something and they were scared and told a young Mexican waiter to come wait us. It wasn't even his section but they told him to go here to us. He is a great waiter, but everyone else here is rude and stared at us like we didn't belong here. Never again coming here. Was going to walk out, but we were hungry.

Worst service of my life. for the last probably, 3 years I've always ordered a kids chicken, I don't have the biggest appetite. I ordered this today and when we received our bill, our waitress charged us for the margarita chicken that is $11.99 instead of the $5.50 for the kids chicken like we received. We asked why when we clearly received something different and she said she would ask the manager and have her change it. About 5 mins later the manager Shelly came over to our table. This was probably the worst experience I have ever had with a restaurant manager. She refused to change the price when we were never informed they would not be charging us anything different. When I told her that I've been ordering this for a long time and I'd never had a problem she was extremely rude and insinuated that I was lying. Shelly should be fired. I will not be returning to this location. Customer service here sucks!!!

We frequent Chili's in our hometown, so we stopped at this one on our way back home after vacation. It was a VERY different experience.  We sat down and we're not greeted for at least 12 minutes. No one would have said anything to us unless I flagged someone down. The food (burgers and wings) took a LONG time to come out. Our drinks were empty most of the time. The southwest eggs rolls are one of our favorites at home, but they looked and tasted very different here. The burgers were okay.  We also love the chocolate molten cake. It was different here also. It was smaller with no signature hardened chocolate on the top.  I am glad we don't live here. It gave us an appreciation for the food and service in our local Chili's.

Just got back from eating at this place in Livermore.  I was quite surprised how bad my order came out.  Even worse, I am a bit shocked at the lack of concern from management.  I ordered the chicken crispers meal.  First, the chicken came out soggy(not crispy and I asked for the crispy version).  I took the breading off and tried to eat the chicken.  I don't know what happened to it but the chicken was not edible.  Didn't taste like real chicken.  It had a rubbery weird texture.  After one bite I decided I couldn't eat the chicken.  Next I tried the corn on a cob.  It was tolerable though had some places that was over seasoned and was really salty and peppery.  The fries were OK.  I am picky so thought it was just me and wasn't going to say anything.  However my boyfriend also tried the chicken and he couldn't get past one bite (note he had a chicken breast and it was fine).  He said it was worse then the worst Chinese chicken he has ever had.  So we let the waitress know about it.  She apologized and said she was going to take it to her manager.  Having worked in customer service, I actually thought something would happen... But to my surprise not only were we charged for everything, the manager never came out to apologize or at the very least check-in with us.  While I do understand mistakes and issues happen, I do not get the ignoring of those issues or lack of customer service.  So unfortunately those actions have caused this negative review (and I found out that this seems to be a common experience) and more then likely the Livermore chili's has lost two more customers.

Me and my boyfriend went here after a long day then driving for an hour and a half back to Sunnyvale from Sacramento so we thought we would make a pit stop because even though we wanted to grab a bite for the road, both of us didn't want fast food.  When we walked in from the wrong door apparently because the parking lot we came from was right outside of the side door so we walked in, not being acknowledged much until we both went up to the host and told her we sat ourselves down on the side since no one noticed. That didn't bother me much. I ordered my favorite appetizer, the chips and salsa, the salsa was so watery i gave up after trying to get something out of it which was disappointing, luckily it was happy hour and it was free or I would have complained how watery and gross it was, the chips were even beyond greasy, my boyfriend told me not to eat them anymore cause they were so greasy and flimsy. He ordered wings and I ordered a chipotle bowl, it was pretty decent, the waitress was sweet but I still probably wouldn't come back here if i was in the area. Didn't feel welcoming.

I frequent this Chili's quite often with my daughters and/or my friend. We come for both, lunch and dinner. For the most part, they are really consistent, food and service wise. There's only been one time when I've had a so-so waitress. She was just a little...blah, for my liking. But other than that, the food has always been good. They've always taken really good care of us. Even when it's busy, the wait to get a table usually isn't that long.  I've sat in the bar one time with my daughters, since it is open seating. I liked our waitress, but it seemed to take longer for everything to happen. Maybe because there was only one waitress in that area and it was busy that night. I probably wouldn't sit in the bar again, with my kids. Maybe fine with a group of friends.  We always seem to order the same thing: chips and salsa. I order the original chicken crispers with double order of fries with ranch. One of my daughters orders the chicken crispers with fries, the other a hamburger with fries and the third one, grilled chicken breast with oranges. They always talk me into getting a molten lava cake too...although they usually don't have to do too much convincing.  Chili's usually sends out good coupons for the weekdays. If you come here often, I'd suggest getting on their e-mail list. The only thing that was weird the last couple of times that we went here was with the molten lava cake. The first time my daughters and I ate one, it tasted like they had put pepper in the mix. I smelled it when she put the plate down. The entire thing didn't taste of it, just one side of it. I thought it was my imagination. Then when I went there again with my friend and my daughters, I smelled it again. My friend said she didn't smell it until she took a bite of it and said that it tasted like pepper. So weird. The place that they're storing them or where they're making them or something...it's somehow getting pepper on it. Not really that good... Anyways, aside from that weird incident, we're a fan of this Chili's. I'll choose this location over the Tracy one any day.

It's a shame how what used to be a awesome restaurant has changed into a horrible place to eat. The fajitas always come with hard and chewy tortillas. The meats are over cooked. My kid got the chicken crispers and fries, fries below room temp and stale, chicken crispers that would give anyone a 2nd degree burn in their mouth. Such a good fail. The only thing worth going for is a bit of silence while your kid attempts to figure out their games

When I sat down today I was told they no longer offer WiFi. I mean, the cost must just be outrageous to provide what almost every other establishment will provide to its customers. Guess I'll have to find a new place to eat and work. It's too bad because I come here regularly and have gotten good food and good service.

Hey!    Went out to dinner with some friends. I got the grilled chicken Caesar salad and water. My other friends had the boneless buffalo wings, bacon cheeseburger, appetizer trio, a chicken sandwich and the chicken fajitas. All yummy food. I ate, they ate, we ate... Five out of a Five-Trans
The true definition of three stars,food just ok, service just ok , atmosphere just ok. Nothing special , typical large chain resturant .

This place was nice if go again and that's saying something seeing as I hate chilis lol. The waiter was very nice. He gave us an entire bag of chips and dip on the house . He was very polite and very attentive although very soft spoken. The food turned it very well. The only reason for the lack of 5 stars was our take home dishes weren't very good they lacked meat which was supposed to being there seeing as we go the fajitas to go. But all in all very good. Very fast service.  Did I mention you can pay at your own table now? Talk about convenient.

Came here for my sOnS 12th birthday and our awesome server Jake made sure we were taken care of.. Good was quick and fresh.. Glad we came here for our sins birthday dinner.. Thank you Jake and the rest of this crew and we will be back for more dinners... Keep up the good job Jake!

Service takes a while. We were seated for a long time before the waitress came to us.  But food was soooo yummy!!!  Dessert even better! Try the bacon chicken quesadilla, and the margherita flatbread! wow!

I love this location! the staff are always very friendly and prompt and I always get my food in a timely manner. I come here at least a few times a month.  Chili's definitely has my business for the best Tex-Mex around

Chicken crispers, chicken crispers.  I love me some chicken crispers!  The past few times I've come here, I've ordered the triple dipper appetizer thingie, where you can choose 3 appetizers.  Kind of like a sampler platter.  I'll order the chicken crispers, potato skins and boneless buffalo wings.  All are very yummy.  And for $10 or whatever the price is, you get a decent amount on your plate.  I always end up taking some home. The service is fine.  We're usually seated right away and our server pays attention to us and gets us what we need.  Nothing special. I did use the restroom on my last visit and my stall didn't have any toilet paper, which is why I knocked off a star.

Average tasting food. Overpriced for what you get. They even screw you on the amount of fries you get with your burger. I remember when you ordered a burger and got a whole plate of fries... Service is good. The place seems clean.

Tonight my boyfriend and I were too tired to cook, my boyfriend had a very long stressful day at work, he was not in a good mood and very hungry. We decided to go to chilis for a quick bite, and that's exactly what we got. TOM got us right in, sat us down at our table, we told him we wanted food quick, he got us our drinks within about 45 seconds, our meals ordered in and out to us in an expedited manor, and it was delicious. We were in the restaurant a total of 30 minutes! He met our needs and understood what we were looking for. Tom gave the best customer service we've ever experienced at a chain restaurant! Thank you tom!

I like Chili's. What can I say. They redecorated and the color scheme is nice and they opened up the center portion so it's much airier. Very nice. They took down all the posters and tchotchke I suppose because Applebee's has the patent on that now but the artwork they put up is a little sterile and generic. They should fix that. Don't let Applebee's push you around, Chili's!

We came to Chili's today for lunch to celebrate my boyfriend's dad's birthday. We were seated quickly. It looks like they've redone the menus. Our server greeted us quickly and took our drink order. He suggested margaritas.  Umm buddy, it's one'o'clock, no. He seemed pretty disappointed when we ordered one iced tea and three waters. He came back with our drinks barely two minutes later and asked if we were ready to order, even though we were all clearly still looking at the menus. He came back again five or so minutes later and we were ready to order. My boyfriend ordered first and got a burger. The server asked if he wanted to add avocado for 75 cents. He said no. I also ordered a burger, and he also asked me if I wanted avocado for 75 cents. I said no.  Our food came quickly. The food was actually really good. The server came back only ten minutes after we got our food with the check and said "no rush but I'll just leave this here for you".  All in all, good food, but our server was really pushy-from suggesting margaritas at 1'o'clock to asking to add avocado, to bringing the check within ten minutes.

We've tried to avoid chain restaurants since being here, but we've been trying to find a reliable place to go if we just wanted something simple, like fajitas.  Mostly, the tex-mex restaurants have let us down. So it's odd to report that The Wife has declared the fajitas here to be the best she's had on the West Coast, and after trying them a few nights ago myself, I have to agree.  We also both love the rice and black beans that come with.  I was already addicted to the nachos here from years past - they are really quite different than anywhere else, and very tasty.  I'm also a fan of the oldtimer burgers.  So if we need a protein-fix, this is like a guilty-pleasure place to go for us.

Recently remodeled. And speedy for lunch finally!! in the past you couldn't get out of this joint in under a hour. But this day we had our lunch and drinks and left Chili's around 35 Minutes.  Lunch specials are great.

After not going for at least a year, we decided to give it another try... Down to 1 star. Some advice for the manager: train your hostess/waitresses a little better. My husband and I had this little exchange with the hostess: Hostess: Would you like to sit in the bar area for happy hour? Me: No, thank you. Hostess: It's happy hour! Me: No, just a regular table. Hostess: *Must have misunderstood what I just said, the look on her face was as if I just told her I killed her dog; unhappily takes us to a table, puts the menus down and walks away* Me to my husband: .....what just happened? It also didn't help that he had to kill a pincher bug (GAAAAH!) on the table - thank God he was sitting on that side of the booth, because had I seen it first the entire restaurant would've heard my scream (I'm afraid of pincher bugs, shut up). I don't see a situation where we will be back. Womp womp.

After my most recent visit, I had to knock Chili's down a star.  Probably shouldn't have been five stars in the first place, but I'm still a sucker for their Boneless Buffalo Chicken. My husband and I ate here to celebrate our first night out without our sons (2 years old and 1 month old).  Heaven!  I had a gift card so it was nice to save some money after buying mountains of diapers.   This time I ordered the Chicken Fajita Quesadilla.  What do you think Chili's means by "fajita"?  Bell peppers and onions, right?  Sadly, they just mean onions.  So I had a chicken and onion quesadilla.  Can you say "lacking"? Pluses would still be their dirty martinis and on this visit we had an exceptionally nice server.  She even showed me a picture of her daughter.  How Livermore!  I love it.

Had dinner on Friday night. It was disappointing.  We had the rib eye dinner.  Turned out the potatoes and broccoli were the best part of the meal.  The rib eyes were not only barely warm  but very tough.  Now we have had them before and they were great so we know Chilis could go better.  Also our waitress was really not up to par.  We had to request  refills on our drinks by flagging her down and when it came time to pay, she took my credit card and walked off.  No check holder or tally.  I normally leave a generous tip.  Needless to say, she did not get one

This is my favorite place to go with and without the family.  Food is always good and you can't beat the 2/20 deals.   Things have gotten even better now that they have a rewards program (love that we don't have to search for coupons anymore).

DO NOT EAT HERE . . . if you want a great place to have a drink & watch the game this is it. Good service, cheap happy hour drink specials. We stopped in to watch the Clemson/Ohio St game, nice friendly crowd. Free chips & salsa!!!

First of all, the girl at the door needs to be willing to help customers rather than chatting with coworkers.  Stupid young and clueless waitresses who don't give a shit about customers really annoy me. The food was great (fajita trio) so that was a relief. Now the bathroom...can't they check at least a few times a day and not have trash, toilet papers, etc. scattered all over the bathroom?  It is a restaurant and it really grossed me out that they'd leave a bathroom in that condition. We got the white chocolate molten cake but it took like 30 minutes to come...not like it was busy.  It was good but after that long of a wait with stupid waitresses sitting and chatting away instead of taking care of customers were buzz kill.  The bartender was more attentive to the customers at the bar than the waitresses.  We should have sat at the bar. Oh well, what can we expect from a chain?

Felix: This is probably the worst Chili's restaurant I've ever gone to!  We love Chilis don't get me wrong for their value menus like 2 for 20, happy hour, etc.  But come on! As a chain restaurant, they've got to get it together!  First of all the hostess did not even greet us nor smiled at us.  Our waiter looked overwhelmed with what's going on.  As far as food--- They served us Over salted greasy tortilla chips, Trio Fajita arrived not sizzling and not hot (looked like they just MICROWAVED it!).  My kids cheese pizza dough was underdone!  Bad review!  We will never come back at this location anymore.
Chilli's is one of those "satisfaction guaranteed" type of places. The food is...American...meaning, fried, cheap corn fed beef, etc, etc, but tasty none the less.

While I normally avoid chain restaurants, we were in a weird mood and decided that it has been long enough and wanted to give it another chance.  I perused nutritinal information to try to make my decision and found only one or two options that were a reasonable caloric level to consume. The calorie information was not on the menu itself, but a booklet on the table.  The server was patient but the food was boring. Felt like a waste of money for the quality.  They have a good $20 dinner for 2 deal that includes and app and 2 entrees. None of the choices were healthy or vegetarian. None. We could easily consumed over 2000 cals each by going this route. Terrible decision.   My chicken was overcooked but it was alright with me. I'd rather eat overcooked chicken then undercooked!  The service was good though so that's why 3 stars. The food is more like a 2.

My recent letter to Chilis will explain my one star. I just wanted to voice my extreme disappointment in the new layout of my local restaurant... A TV in EVERY corner throughout the entire restaurant??  Chilis used to be our favorite family destination, but we can't have a family meal together when everyone's eyes are drawn to a screen.  It used to be you could go out to get AWAY from those things, now we are bombarded with it. I was with my 6 year old son and 3 year old daughter and there was an informercial on with women in tiny bikinis, and the ads on the sports channels are all beer and girls.   Things I don't want my kids influenced by.  And I can't imagine any woman wanting to have a meal with her man while girls are working out on the TV - awkward and inappropriate. Please reconsider turning Chilis back into a restaurant instead of the 100% sports bar it's become.  We will not be back at this point. Thank you.

I recently made a order to go from this establishment for 2 for $20.  I was set to pick up my order at  7:15pm. My order wasn't "ready" until 7:35pm.  The hostess in front was rude, she didn't smile, greet me properly, and overall unprofessional. When I finally did get my order and home, we noticed a few key items missing. For  one, the burger I ordered only came with the burger. No fries. and secondly... My food was cold. I live less than 5 minutes away from Chilies. I had to microwave my whole order.  Now that I'm posting this the day after, I still feeling sick from after I ate my meal. To summarize what I've experienced, DONT go to this Chili's they're awful.  Worse customer service.... missing food from order, and the worse to come... ice cold food on a ordered pickup.

While the food was very good tonight, the speed of service left something to be desired. I understand that it was busy, but we felt a bit forgotten about. Even though our waitress passed our table numerous times, she didn't apparently notice our empty water glasses. And we waited almost forty minutes to receive our order on a Tuesday night. Now I know why I choose to go elsewhere unless it's not a peak time. Our server was very pleasant, however, maybe they could use another person helping out.

Little packed on football Sunday. Get there early...before the games..if you want a seat in the bar area. The food in my opinion has taken a big dive. This chili's used to be my go to place for fajitas but the meat has turned questionable to say the least. I also used to enjoy the sirloin but the last couple of times it was the same exact cut of questionable meat as the crappy fajitas. I used to go there weekly, then monthly, now I don't know if I will return.

Besides a few good laughs between my sister and I about the horrible meal/service I recieved at this Chilies, I was really turned off about the whole experience. Food: I had the Chicken Fajitas. When the server brought out the pan I was taken back at how hot and unprepared the whole meal was. I joked with my sister while I was literally stiring the food while it was still cooking. I was doing so for not for a minute, but somewhere between 3-5! I couldn't believe it! It was a decent meal but in a way I felt that I deserved a discount for partcipating in the cooking process!! Service: The waiter was very poor blaming staff for his performance. We had huge gaps with no service and he appeared very annoyed and unhappy working there. I would definitly not waste my time or cash at this place.

Mmmmmm, burger - original quick tip. I'm going to upgrade my rating  to a full three stars.  I do like their burgers, they are juicy, tasty, and you have a variety of ways to have them prepared.  The service is attentive and there is a modest variety of choices though it is no more than what's offered in other bar and grills. It doesn't get 4-stars because the prices have crept up.  They may be more expensive than Fudd's and not as gourmet.  Their fries are standard-fare and unlike Fudd's, you can't get the cheese sauce.  It would be unfair to rank this below that day-of-the-week that comes after Thursday, but it is still two full notches above A-Bees.

I was here about three weeks ago. I ordered take-out an hour and a half in advance just to prepare for my thirty minute lunch. When I arrive to pick up my food, there's no one at the counter. I was actually there for all of 10 minutes and passed by at least four people and still hadn't been greeted. There were two chatter boxes standing in the visible prep area that seen me walk in, but were too busy discussing their drama to say anything. The bartender was also in  the prep area, seen me walk in as well, walked pass me as if to say, "I don't service this area", but still didn't greet me verbally. Then I had to watch the guy that finally stumbled upon little ol' me, bag everything, put stuff in containers and spill proof everything up nice and neatly. I'm thinking I surely didn't come here for the presentation of a take-out order that I called in waaaaaay in advance to allot myself time to eat it.

This Chili's is close to my office and has been in the regular rotation for lunch with co-workers for years. Over the past month, however, there has been a noticeable decline in the quality of food. It is just one step above fast food and over priced for that standard. Today, for example, I ordered chicken nachos. I am more impressed with  what I could have gotten at Taco Bell! They were served lukewarm, with burnt cheese, and no chicken. I passed on adding guacamole after seeing it go by on another plate, looking grey. I would be hard pressed to say the food was mediocre. Another hard decision would be to go back again for lunch, if it hadn't been for our server, Andrea. Her great  customer service, and concern for our dining experience will sway me to give it another chance.

Ordered food online.  ordering process was fine but I had to wait an additional 10 minutes after the 20 minutes I was told from online services and when I got there the place was not busy at all.  When I got home the food wasn't even luke warm.  Taste was good but very disappointed that I couldn't get a warm meal from them and when I called to let them know, they said the kitchen was busy and that next time they promise I will get a warm meal.  I wanted a warm meal this time!
Okay service and okay food. I have had better in big cities. But its cheap and its decent.

The service is generally good and the ambiance is about what you'd expect from a restaurant of this type.   I really like their fries and the fact that they offer a black bean patty option on the burgers for those of us who don't eat beef but still want a burger like experience. I also like the build your own burger option they added recently. Portions and prices are reasonable. This isn't a place you'll take somebody you want to impress but its central location just off the freeway, solid menu and competent management make it a much better bet than the Applebees just up the street.

I kinda liked the place. It's a comfortable place to eat. The waiter was friendly and made recommendations when we were ordering, for me it was good, for my husband not so much.  The food was good, not great. And dessert was much needed.

I go to Chili's once maybe twice a year when i get duped by one of their commercials and every single time I go I rediscover how mediocre their food is.  The same can be said for Applebees, TGIFs, and other mainstream chains of similar mediocrity.   Things to note.. their Kickin' Jack Nachos are really salty - not sure if this was just a bad batch but I've also noticed how much the "American" palette craves it. (On a sidenote, why do some people reach for the salt shaker before they've even tasted their food?  Maybe a subconscious custom?)  Service was pretty good though.

You can't beat Chili's for the value. The $6,$7,$8 lunch specials are the best deal in town (so to speak). The food is good and the service is friendly and usually efficient. They're good about resolving issues as well.

This review is all about the server.  Our servers name was "James" and he was one of the best we've ever had.  He was friendly, joked with us and helped make sure we ordered exactly what we wanted.  They have a "design your own fajita" thing and I was having a hard time deciding what to order so he helped me with some suggestions and I loved how it turned out.  I hope the management at this location take notice and acknowledge James accordingly.  And for the record, we didn't know James before we went there, haven't talked to him since, and had to wait to figure out his name because I knew I was going to yelp about the visit.  He told us when we were first seated, but I wasn't paying much attention because I had no idea that I would leave wanting to yelp about our great experience. I did go with just my oldest daughter and let her pick the place.  We had a nice time.  Ordered chips and queso, I ordered the make your own fajitas thing and my daughter ordered some sort of burger.  It was all outstanding and we will definitely go back provided we can be seated in James area. Thanks James for the great service.  We plan to return and ask to be seated in your are.
Eat there regularly.  Great comfort food.  Order take out frequently.  They are always great service.

2 stars sounds rather harsh, however its not that great, so thats whay they deserve. Service isn't the best, although the last time we went it was better. They had some issue with not giving our table to other party's like they kept forgetting about us?!?! whats up with that? I really like their presidente margarita! you get the little shaker thing and all, gets me rather buzzed, but i'm a light weight and I do not like to taste alcohol. food is always meh. Its not great food, its chilis food. In fact, I could make it much better at home, however sometimes you are just not in the mood to cook nor clean up--hence you are going to crappy places like chilis.

Very knowledgeable about gluten-free menu choices.  I was recently in and asked the server if their tortilla chips are fried in a dedicated fryer. He went back to check, said they weren't, but that they were going to change the oil and fry up a new batch (it was early- 11:30, so they had the time to do this).  I loved the thoughtfulness of the server and the cook and I savored those fresh chips... YUM!   The next time I came in for lunch I asked the same question, but this time I wasn't as lucky. However, the manager did come over and explain how the fryer worked and when they changed the oil, etc.  He was very knowledgeable about food allergies and cross-contamination and made me feel very secure in my meal choice.  His staff was also educated and that is very important to anyone with a food-related allergy/intolerance/disease.

Had the country fried steak which came out burnt, sent it back and came out burnt again (maybe if they put more than a tablespoon of gravy could if at least tried to hide they burnt taste).  The manager was the person who brought the food out and when I told I didn't want it she just said ok and walked a way.  Terrible place will never go back

We absolutely love this place for 2 reasons. One, it's kid friendly, and two, our server for our most recent 3 trips has been Michael, who is just about the best server ever. We eat out frequently, but I can not sing this guy's praises enough. He is the reason we return. He is so on the ball, our drinks are never empty, he always bring extra napkins if the kids are with us, and he's obviously a hard worker. He takes the time to relate on a more personal level, sharing stories about his babies, and it's just an all around pleasant experience when he is our server. In the past we've had good service with others as well, but Michael just makes our meal!

You and seven others just threw yourself out of a plane....where are you going to go next??? Chili's in Livermore...thats where!  Suburbia at its finest.  Are we in Nebraska?  Are we in New Mexico?  Who knows, but it all looks the same, and it all tastes the same.  I like Chili's....always have, so 4 stars to staying a consistent corporate restaurant...and feeding our depleting adrenaline highs, and for being the total opposite of what we did in the morning.  But really, where would you go? We even got chocolate shakes for the birthday kids, and they sang to us!  How long has it been since that has happened?  A while I'd bet.

When I lived in Livermore I used to frequent this location often.  I was in the area yesterday and decided to drop in for a bite to eat.  I remember this place usually being pretty busy, even on week nights.  So I was surprised to see the place pretty much empty.  What surprised me even more, was the slow service that came with the empty restaurant.  Took over an hour to get my food.  We had a party of 5, everyones food came out correct with no issues, hence the 2 stars, but EVERYONE'S food was cold!  I mean come on now, there was like 5 parties in the entire restaurant, very SLOW service and COLD food is just unacceptable in any situation, but even worse when its that slow.  Just goes to show that they don't really care much on customer service or quality of there product.

Most of my four star rating is because of the service Kasie provides in the bar area.  My fiance and I eat here once a month and always sit in the bar area.  Kasie never ceases to amaze me.  She always has the entire bar area to herself and she delivers superb service.  She is very friendly and personable.  The food is fairly consistent but we always stick to burgers and salads.  If Kasie ever leaves Chili's they will be losing a huge asset.

So chili's is okay! The food is alright, they have some good deals though. Just went in there for lunch today and I was so disguised, after I had ordered my food I look over to see women laughing , I then notice a HUGE really fluffy dog in the restaurant. I thought I hope that is a service dog! It was not! How gross! I am trying to eat my food and there is a huge dog sitting there. On top of that, every server, hostess, and manager walked right over it like it wasn't even there.  I would have left had I not ordered my food. I will not be back. That is so gross, the person I was with is allergic to dogs, and that is  huge health code violation. GROSS CHILI'S!!!!!
